title: Social Security Workers Struggle to Meet Demand After DOGE Cuts
summary: After this year’s staffing cuts, some people wait for hours, others sail through. But overburdened field office workers carry the weight.

title: What to Know About the ICE Shooting, and a Rare Climate Pledge from China
summary: Plus, how big was Jimmy Kimmel’s first night back?

title: With His Pivot on Ukraine, Trump May Be Washing His Hands of the War
summary: President Trump has shown dwindling interest in mediating a peace accord, joining European “security guarantees” for Ukraine or providing aid and intelligence to the Ukrainians.

title: U.S. Attorney Races to Present Case Against James Comey
summary: It remains to be seen whether a career prosecutor would be willing to present a case to a grand jury or whether jurors would bring an indictment.

title: JD Vance Spars With Jon Favreau Over Dallas Shooting Information
summary: In the aftermath of a violent episode, political figures quickly engaged with one another on social media.

title: What We Know About the Shooting at a Dallas ICE Facility
summary: One detainee was killed and two others were wounded after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The gunman died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Sarkozy Found Guilty of Conspiracy to Seek Libyan Money and Sentenced to Prison
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy, former president of France, was sentenced to five years in prison over a plot to fund his election bid with help from the government of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: Our Best Fall Baking Recipes
summary: It’s Bake Time! Celebrate the launch of our baking newsletter (and start of the season) with these crowd-pleasing recipes.

title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Return Draws 6.2 Million Viewers, Ratings Show
summary: The first episode of “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” since it was suspended last week by Disney attracted nearly four times as much as its average viewership.

title: Son of Mother Killed by Geoffrey West Urges Alabama to Halt Execution
summary: William Berry has urged Alabama officials to stop the execution of Geoffrey West, arguing that it would bring neither justice nor closure.

title: What Declines in Reading and Math Mean for the U.S. Work Force
summary: U.S. employers and colleges are contending with more young people who are behind academically. Some are trying to make up where schools have failed.

title: As Mamdani Rises, South Asians Emerge as a Political Force in New York
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s upstart campaign for mayor of New York City is inspiring the growing South Asian community to be more active in politics.

title: Kamala Harris Reinforces Support for Zohran Mamdani in Phone Call
summary: The conversation came two days after Ms. Harris, the former vice president, gave a muted endorsement to Mr. Mamdani’s bid for mayor of New York City.

title: 10 (More) Questions With Andrew Cuomo
summary: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who is running for mayor of New York City as an independent, visited The New York Times for an interview.

title: There Are More Robots Working in China Than the Rest of the World Combined
summary: China has embarked on a campaign to use more robots in its factories, transforming its manufacturing industries and becoming the dominant maker.

title: We Need to Think Straight About God and Politics
summary: My problem with the conversation about Kirk’s killing is that many people seem to have no coherent idea about the proper relationship between faith and politics.

title: Times Reporters Answer Your Vaccine Questions
summary: We received hundreds of queries about efficacy, safety, cost and access.

title: Kimmel Says There’s Plenty of Room in the ‘Bad Ratings’ Club
summary: The late night host pointed to President Trump’s approval level after he said on social media to “let Jimmy Kimmel rot in his bad ratings.”

title: Now Arriving, a New Theory of In-Flight Turbulence
summary: Physicists have devised a new model to account for the discomfort that airline passengers know all too well.

title: Kashmir’s Apple Harvest Rots After Landslide Blocks Road
summary: The Himalayan region supplies most of India’s apples. But when heavy rains left a major highway blocked for weeks, farmers couldn’t get them to markets.

title: Richard Moe, 88, Dies; Led the National Trust for Historic Preservation
summary: After serving as an aide to Vice President Walter Mondale, he spent 17 years at the forefront of the fight to save numerous endangered landmarks.

title: Woman, 50, Killed by Midtown Manhattan Driver in Hit-and-Run Crash
summary: A driver hit the woman and her husband, tourists from Germany, near Bryant Park on Wednesday afternoon. Her husband, 55, was injured, the police said.
